children.name: zoomEnd
children.description: Fires when the user stops zooming the chart.

children.name: zoom
children.description: Fires as long as the user is zooming the chart using the mousewheel.

children.name: zoomStart
children.description: Fires when the user has used the mousewheel to zoom the chart.The zoom operation can be aborted by calling `e.preventDefault()`.

children.name: seriesHover
children.description: Fires when chart series are hovered.

children.name: seriesClick
children.description: Fires when chart series are clicked.

children.name: plotAreaClick
children.description: Fires when plot area is clicked.

children.name: dragEnd
children.description: Fires when the user stops dragging the sparkline.

children.name: drag
children.description: Fires as long as the user is dragging the sparkline using the mouse or swipe gestures.

children.name: dragStart
children.description: Fires when the user has used the mouse or a swipe gesture to drag the sparkline.The drag operation can be aborted by calling `e.preventDefault()`.

children.name: dataBound
children.description: Fires when the sparkline has received data from the data sourceand is about to render it.

children.name: axisLabelClick
children.description: Fires when an axis label is clicked.

children.name: imageDataURL
Example - show a snapshot of the Sparkline

children.description: Returns a PNG image of the sparkline encoded as a [Data URL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/data_URIs).> This method is deprecated and replaced by [exportImage](#methods-exportImage).

children.name: svg
children.description: Returns the [SVG](http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/) representation of the chart.The returned string is a self-contained SVG document that can be used as is orconverted to other formats using tools like [Inkscape](http://inkscape.org/) and[ImageMagick](http://www.imagemagick.org/).Both programs provide command-line interface suitable for server-side processing.> This method is obsoleted by [exportSVG](#methods-exportSVG), but will remain fully functional.

children.name: setOptions
children.description: Sets the widget options. Changes are cumulative.

children.name: setDataSource
children.description: Sets the dataSource of an existing Chart and rebinds it.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Reloads the data and repaints the chart.

children.name: exportSVG

parameters.name: options.raw `Boolean` *(default: false)*
parameters.description: Resolves the promise with the raw SVG document without the Data URI prefix.

children.description: Exports the chart as an SVG document.Inherited from [Chart.exportSVG](chart#methods-exportSVG)

children.name: exportPDF

parameters.name: options `kendo.drawing.PDFOptions` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Parameters for the exported PDF file.

children.description: Exports the chart as a PDF file.Inherited from [Chart.exportPDF](chart#methods-exportPDF)

children.name: exportImage

parameters.name: options.height `String`
parameters.description: The height of the exported image. Defaults to the chart height.

parameters.name: options.width `String`
parameters.description: The width of the exported image. Defaults to the chart width.

children.description: Exports the chart as an image.Inherited from [Chart.exportImage](chart#methods-exportImage)

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the Sparkline for safe removal from the DOM.Detaches event handlers and removes data entries in order to avoid memory leaks.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.line.length
Example - set the value axis note color width

children.description: The line length of the note.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.line.color
Example - set the value axis note color width

children.description: The line color of the note.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.line.width
Example - set the value axis note line width

children.description: The line width of the note.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.line
children.description: The line of the note.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.position
children.description: The position of the value axis note label.* "inside" - the label is positioned inside of the icon.* "outside" - the label is positioned outside of the icon.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.text
Example - set the value axis label note text

children.description: The label note text.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.format
Example - set the value axis note label format

children.description: The format used to display the note label. Uses [kendo.format](/api/framework/kendo#methods-format). Contains one placeholder ("{0}") which represents the axis value.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.rotation
Example - rotate the value axis note label

children.description: The rotation angle of the label. By default the label are not rotated.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.visible
Example - hide the value axis note label

children.description: If set to `true` the chart will display the value axis notes label. By default the value axis notes label are visible.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.template
Example - set the value axis note label template as a string

children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the labels.The fields which can be used in the template are:* value - the axis value

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.font
Example - set the value axis note label font

children.description: The font style of the note label.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.color
Example - set the value axis note label color as a hex string

children.description: The text color of the note label. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.border.width
Example - set the value axis note label border width

children.description: The width of the border in pixels. By default the border width is set to zero which means that the border will not appear.

children.name: valueAxis.notes.data.label.border.dashType
Example - set the value axis note label border dash type

children.description: The dash type of the border.The following dash types are supported:* "dash" - a line consisting of dashes* "dashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot* "dot" - a line consisting of dots* "longDash" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash* "longDashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot* "longDashDotDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot-dot* "solid" - a solid line

Example - set the value axis note label border color

children.description: The color of the border. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

Example - set the value axis note label border

children.description: The border of the label.

children.description: Reverses the axis direction -values increase from right to left and from top to bottom.

children.description: The color of the plot band.

children.description: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

children.description: The start position of the plot band in axis units.

children.description: The plot bands of the value axis.

children.description: Prevents the automatic axis range from snapping to 0.

children.description: The unique axis name.

children.description: The interval between minor divisions.It defaults to 1/5th of the majorUnit.

children.description: The color of the value axis minor ticks lines. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.description: The axis minor tick size. This is the length of the line in pixels that is drawn to indicate the tick on the chart.

children.description: The width of the lines.Note that this settings has no effect if the visibility of the minor grid lines is not set to **true**.

children.name: valueAxis.minorGridLines.color

children.description: Configures the minor grid lines.  These are the lines that are an extension of the minor ticks through the

children.description: The minimum value of the axis.This is often used in combination with the **max** configuration option.

children.name: valueAxis.max
children.description: The maximum value of the axis.This is often used in combination with the **min** configuration option.

children.name: valueAxis.majorUnit
children.description: The interval between major divisions.

children.description: The skip of the value axis major ticks.

children.description: The axis major tick size. This is the length of the line in pixels that is drawn to indicate the tick on the chart.

children.description: The major ticks of the axis.

children.description: The skip of the value axis major grid lines.

children.description: Configures the major grid lines. These are the lines that are an extension of the major ticks through thebody of the chart.

children.description: The width of the line. This will also effect the major and minor ticks, butnot the grid lines.

children.description: The type of stack to plot. The following types are supported:* "normal" - the value of the stack is the sum of all points in the category (or group)* "100%" - the value of the stack is always 100% (1.00). Points within the category (or group) are represented as percentages.

children.name: seriesDefaults.stack
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the series should be stacked.> The `stack` options is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "bar", "column", "line", "area", "verticalLine", "verticalArea", "radarLine", "radarArea" and "radarColumn".

children.description: Configures the series data labels.

children.name: seriesDefaults.gap
children.description: The distance between category clusters.

children.name: seriesDefaults.column
children.description: The column configuration options.The default options for all column series. For more details see the series options.

children.name: seriesDefaults.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: seriesDefaults.border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.

children.name: seriesDefaults.border.color
children.description: The color of the border.

children.name: seriesDefaults.border
children.description: The border of the series.

children.name: seriesDefaults.bar
children.description: The default options for all bar series. For more details see the series options.

children.name: seriesDefaults.area
children.description: The area configuration options.The default options for all area series. For more details see the series options.

children.name: seriesDefaults
children.description: Default values for each series.

children.name: seriesColors
children.description: The default colors for the chart's series. When all colors are used, new colors are pulled from the start again.

children.name: series.zIndex
Example - Change the series stacking order

children.description: An optional Z-index that can be used to change the default stacking order of series.The series with the highest Z-index will be placed on top.Series with no Z-index will use the default stacking order based on series type.For example line series will be on top with bar and area following below.

children.name: series.notes.line.length
children.description: The length of the connecting lines in pixels.

children.name: series.notes.line.color
children.description: The line color of the notes.

children.name: series.notes.line.width
children.description: The line width of the notes.

children.name: series.notes.line
children.description: The line of the notes.

children.name: series.notes.label.position
children.description: The position of the labels.* "inside" - the label is positioned inside of the icon.* "outside" - the label is positioned outside of the icon.

children.name: series.notes.label.format
children.description: The format used to display the notes label. Uses [kendo.format](/api/framework/kendo#methods-format). Contains one placeholder ("{0}") which represents the axis value.

children.name: series.notes.label.rotation
children.description: The rotation angle of the label. By default the label are not rotated.

children.name: series.notes.label.visible
children.description: If set to `true` the chart will display the series notes label. By default the series notes label are visible.

children.name: series.notes.label.template
children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the labels.The fields which can be used in the template are:* value - the point value

children.name: series.notes.label.font
children.description: The font style of the label.

children.name: series.notes.label.color
children.description: The text color of the label. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: series.notes.label.border.width
children.description: The width of the border in pixels. By default the border width is set to zero which means that the border will not appear.

children.name: series.notes.label.border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.The following dash types are supported:* "dash" - a line consisting of dashes* "dashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot* "dot" - a line consisting of dots* "longDash" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash* "longDashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot* "longDashDotDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot-dot* "solid" - a solid line

children.name: series.notes.label.border.color
children.description: The color of the border. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: series.notes.label.border
children.description: The border of the label.

children.name: series.notes.label.background
children.description: The background color of the label. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: series.notes.label
children.description: The label of the notes.

children.name: series.notes.icon.visible
children.description: The icon visibility.

children.name: series.notes.icon.type
children.description: The icon shape.The supported values are:* "circle" - the marker shape is circle.* "square" - the marker shape is square.* "triangle" - the marker shape is triangle.* "cross" - the marker shape is cross.

children.name: series.notes.icon.size
children.description: The size of the icon.

children.name: series.notes.icon.border.width
children.description: The border width of the icon.

children.name: series.notes.icon.border.color
children.description: The border color of the icon.

children.description: The border of the icon.

children.name: series.notes.icon.background
children.description: The background color of the notes icon.

children.name: series.notes.position
children.description: The position of the series note.* "top" - The note is positioned on the top.* "bottom" - The note is positioned on the bottom.* "left" - The note is positioned on the left.* "right" - The note is positioned on the right.

children.description: The icon of the notes.

children.description: The line width.** Available for line series **

children.name: series.tooltip.visible
children.description: A value indicating if the tooltip should be displayed.

children.name: series.tooltip.template
children.description: The tooltip template.Template variables:*   **value** - the point value (either a number or an object)*   **category** - the category name*   **series** - the data series*   **dataItem** - the original data item used to construct the point.        Will be null if binding to array.

children.name: series.tooltip.padding
children.description: The padding of the tooltip.

children.name: series.tooltip.format
children.description: The tooltip format. Format variables depend on the series type:* Area, bar, column, line and pie    *   **0** - value

children.name: series.tooltip.font
children.description: The tooltip font.

children.name: series.tooltip.color
children.description: The text color of the tooltip. The default is the same as the series labels color.

children.name: series.tooltip.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: series.tooltip.border.color
children.description: The color of the border.

children.name: series.tooltip.border
children.description: The border configuration options.

children.name: series.tooltip.background
children.description: The background color of the tooltip. The default is determined from the series color.

children.name: series.tooltip
children.description: The data point tooltip configuration options.

children.name: series.stack.group
children.description: Indicates that the series should be stacked in a group with the specified name.> The `group` option is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "bar" or "column".

children.name: series.stack.type
children.description: The type of stack to plot. The following types are supported:* "normal" - the value of the stack is the sum of all points in the category (or group)* "100%" - the value of the stack is always 100% (1.00). Points within the category (or group) are represented as percentages.

children.name: series.stack
children.description: A boolean value indicating if the series should be stacked.A string value is interpreted as [series.stack.group](#configuration-series.stack.group).> The `stack` options is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "bar", "column", "line", "area", "verticalLine", "verticalArea", "radarLine", "radarArea" and "radarColumn".> Stack settings of the first series are applied to the rest of the series.

children.name: series.spacing
children.description: Space between points as proportion of the point width.** Available for bar and column series. **

children.name: series.startAngle
children.description: The start angle of the first segment.**Available for pie series.**

children.name: series.size
children.description: The size (or radius) of the series in pixels.If not specified, the available space is split evenly between the series.**Available for only.**

children.name: series.padding
children.description: The padding around the chart (equal on all sides).** Available for pie series. **

children.name: series.overlay.gradient
children.description: The gradient name.Available options:* **glass** (bar and column series)* **roundedBevel** (pie series)* **sharpBevel** (pie series)* **none**

children.name: series.overlay
children.description: The effects overlay.

children.name: series.opacity
children.description: The series opacity.

children.name: series.negativeColor
children.description: Color to use for bars with negative values.** Applicable only to bar and column series. **

children.name: series.style
children.description: The supported values are:* "normal" - The values will be connected with straight line.* "step" - The values will be connected with a line with right angle.* "smooth" - The values will be connected with a smooth line.> The default value is "normal".> The `style` option is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "line".

children.name: series.missingValues
Example - set the missing values behavior

children.description: The behavior for handling missing values. The supported values are:* "gap" - the plot stops before the missing point and continues after it.* "interpolate" - the value is interpolated from neighboring points.* "zero" - the value is assumed to be zero.> The default value is "interpolate", except for "area" and stacked series which default to "zero".> The `missingValues` option is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "area", "line", "scatterLine", "radarLine", "radarArea", "polarLine" or "polarArea".

children.name: series.markers.rotation
children.description: The rotation angle of the markers.

children.description: The markers visibility.

children.name: series.markers.type
children.description: Configures the markers shape type.

children.name: series.markers.size
children.description: The marker size.

children.name: series.markers.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: series.markers.border.color
children.description: The color of the border.

children.name: series.markers.border
children.description: The border of the markers.

children.name: series.markers.background
children.description: The background color of the current series markers.

children.name: series.markers
children.description: Marker options.** Applicable to area and line series **

children.name: series.line.style
children.description: The supported values are:* "normal" - The values will be connected with straight line.* "step" - The values will be connected with a line with right angle.* "smooth" - The values will be connected with a smooth line.> The default value is "normal".> The `style` option is supported when [series.type](#configuration-series.type) is set to "area".

children.name: series.line.width
children.description: The line width.

children.description: The line opacity.

children.description: Line options.** Applicable to area series. **

children.description: The visibility of the labels.

children.name: series.labels.template
children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the chart series label.The fields which can be used in the template are:*   category - the category name. Available for area, bar, column, bubble, donut, line and pie series.*   dataItem - the original data item used to construct the point. Will be null if binding to array.*   percentage - the point value represented as a percentage value. Available only for donut, pie and 100% stacked charts.*   series - the data series*   value - the point value. Can be a number or object containing each bound field.

children.description: Defines the position of the labels.

children.description: The padding of the labels.

children.description: The format of the labels.

children.description: The font style of the labels.

children.description: The text color of the labels.

children.description: Defines the alignment of the labels.** Available for pie series. **

children.description: Configures the series data labels.

children.description: The distance between category clusters.** Applicable for bar and column series. **

children.name: series.connectors.width
children.description: The width of the connector line.

children.name: series.connectors.padding
children.description: The padding between the connector line and the label, and connector line and pie chart.

children.name: series.connectors.color
children.description: The color of the connector line.

children.description: The label connectors options.** Applicable to pie series. **

children.name: series.colorField
children.description: The data field containing the point color.** Applicable for bar, column and pie series. **

children.name: series.color
children.description: The series base color. The supported values are:* CSS color string, including hex and rgb* function(point) - user-defined function that will be evaluated for each point. Returning `undefined` will assume the default series color.

children.name: series.categoryField
children.description: The data field containing the point category name.** Applicable to pie series. **

children.name: series.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: series.border.opacity
children.description: The border opacity.

children.name: series.border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.

children.name: series.border.color
children.description: The color of the border.  It defaults to the color of the current series.

children.name: series.border
children.description: The border of the points.** Applicable to bar, column and pie series **

children.name: series.axis
children.description: The name of the value axis to use.** Applicable to area, bar, column and line series **

children.name: series.aggregate
children.description: The aggregate function to apply for date series.This function is used when a category (an year, month, etc.) contains two or more points.The function return value is displayed instead of the individual points.The supported values are:* "avg" - the average of all values for the date period.* "count" - the number of values for the date period.* "max" - the highest value for the date period.* "min" - the lowest value for the date period.* "sum" - the sum of all values for the date period. Defaults to 0 if no data points are defined.* "sumOrNull" - the sum of all values for the date period. Defaults to `null` if no data points are defined.* "first" - the first value* function(values, series, dataItems, category) - user-defined aggregate function. Returns single value or data item.* object  - (compound aggregate) **Applicable to "candlestick" and ohlc "series"**. Specifies the aggregate for each data item field.

children.name: series.highlight.visible
children.description: A value indicating if the series points should be highlighted.

children.name: series.highlight.opacity
children.description: The opacity of the highlighted points.** Applicable to pie series. **

children.name: series.highlight.color
children.description: The highlight color.** Available only for pie series **

children.name: series.highlight.border.opacity
children.description: The border opacity.

children.name: series.highlight.border.color
children.description: The border color.

children.name: series.highlight.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: series.highlight.border
children.description: The border of highlighted points. The color is computed automatically from the base point color.** Applicable to pie series. **

children.name: series.highlight
children.description: Configures the appearance of highlighted points.

children.name: series.name
children.description: The series name.The name can also be a [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which sets the name of the series when bound to grouped data source.The fields which can be used in the template are:*   series - the series options*   group - the data group*   group.field - the name of the field used for grouping*   group.value - the field value for this group.

children.name: series.field
children.description: The data field containing the series value.

children.name: series.targetField
children.description: The data field containing the target value.** Available for bullet and verticalBullet series. **** Available for pie series **

children.name: series.currentField
children.description: The data field containing the current value.** Available for bullet and verticalBullet series. **

children.name: series.explodeField
children.description: The data field containing a boolean value that indicates if the sector is exploded.** Available for pie series **

children.name: series.data
children.description: Array of data items. The data item type can be either a:* Array of objects. Each point is bound to the specified series fields.* Array of numbers. Available for area, bar, column, pie and line series.

children.name: series.dashType
children.description: The series line dash type.** Applicable only to line series **

children.name: series.type
children.description: The type of the series. Available types:* area* column (synonym: bar)* line* pie* bullet

children.name: series
children.description: Array of series definitions.The series type is determined by the value of the type field.If a type value is missing, the type is assumed to be the one specified in seriesDefaults.Each series type has a different set of options.> **Info:** Some options accept function as argument. They will be evaluated for each point (supplied as parameter). The theme/seriesDefaults value will be used if no value is returned.

children.name: Example
renderAs
children.description: Sets the preferred rendering engine.If it is not supported by the browser, the Sparkline will switch to the first available mode.The supported values are:* "svg" - renders the widget as inline SVG document, if available* "vml" - renders the widget as VML, if available* "canvas" - renders the widget as a Canvas element, if available.> Using Canvas rendering disables most interactive features.

children.name: pointWidth
children.description: The width to allocate for each data point.

children.description: The width of the border.

children.description: The icon shape.The supported values are:* "circle" - the marker shape is circle.* "square" - the marker shape is square.* "triangle" - the marker shape is triangle.

children.name: categoryAxis.notes.icon
children.description: The icon of the notes.

children.name: categoryAxis.notes.position
children.description: The position of the category axis note.* "top" - The note is positioned on the top.* "bottom" - The note is positioned on the bottom.* "left" - The note is positioned on the left.* "right" - The note is positioned on the right.

children.description: The background color of the tooltip.

children.description: The crosshar tooltip configuration options.

children.name: categoryAxis.crosshair.visible
children.description: The dash type of the crosshair.

children.name: categoryAxis.crosshair.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the crosshair.

children.name: categoryAxis.crosshair.opacity
children.description: The opacity of the crosshair.

children.name: categoryAxis.crosshair.color

children.name: categoryAxis.crosshair
children.description: The crosshair configuration options.

children.name: categoryAxis.visible
children.description: The visibility of the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.maxDateGroups
children.description: Specifies the maximum number of groups (categories) to produce wheneither **baseUnit** is set to "fit" or **baseUnitStep** is set to "auto".This option is ignored in all other cases.

children.name: categoryAxis.weekStartDay
children.description: Specifies the week start day when **baseUnit** is set to "weeks".Use the *kendo.days* constants to specify the day by name.* kendo.days.Sunday (0)* kendo.days.Monday (1)* kendo.days.Tuesday (2)* kendo.days.Wednesday (3)* kendo.days.Thursday (4)* kendo.days.Friday (5)* kendo.days.Saturday (6)

children.name: categoryAxis.roundToBaseUnit
children.description: By default, the first and last dates will be rounded off to the nearest base unit.Specifying **false** for this option will disable this behavior.This option is most useful in combination with explicit **min** and **max** dates.It will be ignored if either bar or column series are plotted on the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.min
children.description: The first date displayed on the axis.By default, the minimum date is the same as the first category.This is often used in combination with the **max** and **roundToBaseUnit** configuration options toset up a fixed date range.

children.name: categoryAxis.max
children.description: The last date displayed on the axis.By default, the minimum date is the same as the last category.This is often used in combination with the **min** and **roundToBaseUnit** configuration options toset up a fixed date range.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.dateFormats
children.description: Date format strings

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.culture
children.description: Culture to use for formatting the dates. See [Globalization](/framework/globalization/overview) for more information.It uses the global culture by default.

children.name: categoryAxis.baseUnitStep
children.description: Sets the step (interval) between categories in base units.Specifiying "auto" will set the step to such value that the total number of categories does not exceed **maxDateGroups**.This option is ignored if **baseUnit** is set to "fit".

children.name: categoryAxis.baseUnit
children.description: The base time interval for the axis.The default baseUnit is determined automatically from the minimum differencebetween subsequent categories. Available options:* minutes* hours* days* weeks* months* years* **fit**Setting **baseUnit** to "fit" will set such base unit and **baseUnitStep**that the total number of categories does not exceed **maxDateGroups**.Series data is aggregated for the specified base unit by using the**series.aggregate** function.

children.name: categoryAxis.autoBaseUnitSteps
children.description: Specifies the discrete **baseUnitStep** values wheneither **baseUnit** is set to "fit" or **baseUnitStep** is set to "auto".The default configuration is as follows:* `minutes: [1, 2, 5, 15, 30]`* `hours: [1, 2, 3, 6, 12]`* `days: [1, 2, 3]`* `weeks: [1, 2]`* `months: [1, 2, 3, 6]`* `years: [1, 2, 3, 5, 10, 25, 50]`Each setting can be overriden individually.

children.name: categoryAxis.type
children.description: The axis type.

children.description: The visibility of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.text
children.description: The text of the title.

children.description: The rotation angle of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.position
children.description: The position of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.margin
children.description: The margin of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.font
children.description: The font style of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.color
children.description: The text color of the title. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.border.color
children.description: The color of the border. Any valid CSS color string will work here, includinghex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.border
children.description: The border of the title.

children.name: categoryAxis.title.background
children.description: The background color of the title. Any valid CSS color string will work here, includinghex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.title
children.description: The title of the category axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.reverse
children.description: Reverses the axis direction -categories are listed from right to left and from top to bottom.

children.name: categoryAxis.plotBands.opacity
children.description: The opacity of the plot band.

children.name: categoryAxis.plotBands.color
children.description: The color of the plot band.

children.name: categoryAxis.plotBands.to
children.description: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

children.name: categoryAxis.plotBands.from
children.description: The start position of the plot band in axis units.

children.name: categoryAxis.plotBands
children.description: The plot bands of the category axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.name
children.description: The unique axis name.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.skip
children.description: The skip of the category axis minor ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.step
children.description: The step of the category axis minor ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.width
children.description: The width of the minor ticks in pixels.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.color
children.description: The color of the category axis minor ticks lines. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.visible
children.description: The visibility of the minor ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks.size
children.description: The axis minor tick size. This is the length of the line in pixels that is drawn to indicate the tickon the chart.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorTicks
children.description: The minor ticks of the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.skip
children.description: The skip of the category axis minor grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.step
children.description: The step of the category axis minor grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.width
children.description: The width of the lines.Note that this setting has no effect if the visibility of the minorgrid lines is not set to **true**.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.visible
children.description: The visibility of the lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines.color
children.description: The color of the lines. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex andrgb.Note that this setting has no effect if the visibility of the minorgrid lines is not set to **true**.

children.name: categoryAxis.minorGridLines
children.description: Configures the minor grid lines.  These are the lines that are an extension of the minor ticks throughthe body of the chart.Note that minor grid lines are not visible by default, therefore none of these settings will take effect with the minor grid lines visibility being set to **true**.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.skip
children.description: The skip of the category axis major ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.step
children.description: The step of the category axis major ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.width
children.description: The width of the major ticks in pixels.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.color
children.description: The color of the category axis major ticks lines. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.visible
children.description: The visibility of the major ticks.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks.size
children.description: The axis major tick size. This is the length of the line in pixels that is drawn to indicate the tickon the chart.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorTicks
children.description: The major ticks of the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.skip
children.description: The skip of the category axis major grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.step
children.description: The step of the category axis major grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.width
children.description: The width of the lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.visible
children.description: The visibility of the lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines.color
children.description: The color of the lines. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.majorGridLines
children.description: Configures the major grid lines.These are the lines that are an extension of the major ticks through the body of the chart.

children.name: categoryAxis.line.width
children.description: The width of the line. This will also effect the major and minor ticks, butnot the grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.line.visible
children.description: The visibility of the lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.line.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the line.

children.name: categoryAxis.line.color
children.description: The color of the lines. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.**Note:** This will also effect the major and minor ticks, but not the grid lines.

children.name: categoryAxis.line
children.description: Configures the axis line. This will also effect major and minor ticks, but not gridlines.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.visible
children.description: The visibility of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.template
children.description: The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the labels.The fields which can be used in the template are:* value - the category value* dataItem - the data item, in case a field has been specified

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.step
children.description: Label rendering step.Every n-th label is rendered where n is the step

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.skip
children.description: Number of labels to skip.Skips rendering the first n labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.rotation
children.description: The rotation angle of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.padding
children.description: The padding of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.mirror
children.description: Mirrors the axis labels and ticks.If the labels are normally on the left side of the axis,mirroring the axis will render them to the right.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.margin
children.description: The margin of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.format
children.description: The format of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.font
children.description: The font style of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.color
children.description: The text color of the labels. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.border.width
children.description: The width of the border.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.border.dashType
children.description: The dash type of the border.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.border.color
children.description: The color of the border. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.border
children.description: The border of the labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels.background
children.description: The background color of the labels. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.

children.name: categoryAxis.labels
children.description: Configures the axis labels.

children.name: categoryAxis.justified
children.description: Positions categories and series points on major ticks. This removes the empty space before and after the series.This option is ignored if either bar or column series are plotted on the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis.field
children.description: The data field containing the category name.

children.name: categoryAxis.color
children.description: Color to apply to all axis elements. Any valid CSS color string will work here, including hex and rgb.Individual color settings for line and labels take priority.

children.name: categoryAxis.categories
children.description: Array of category names.

children.name: categoryAxis.axisCrossingValue
children.description: Category index at which the first value axis crosses this axis. (Only for object)Category indicies at which the value axes cross the category axis. (Only for array)**Note:** Specify an index greater than or equal to the numberof categories to denote the far end of the axis.

children.name: categoryAxis
children.description: The category axis configuration options.

children.name: axisDefaults
children.description: Default options for all chart axes.
